strategy: Apply a deep neural network with multiple hidden layers and dropout regularization, using normalized continuous features and one-hot encoded categorical variables as inputs. Introduce batch normalization and early stopping during training to prevent overfitting. Train on a stratified subset of the data and validate using time-based splits to ensure temporal relevance in real-world housing price prediction.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import xgboost as xgb
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.optim as optim
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader, TensorDataset
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop('SalePrice', axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_val = validation_df.drop('SalePrice', axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop('Id', axis=1)

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values in numerical columns
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))
X_val[numerical_columns] = X_val[numerical_columns].fillna(X_val[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))

# Handle missing values in categorical columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode()[0] if not X_train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].fillna(X_val[col].mode()[0] if not X_val[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mode()[0] if not X_test[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')

# One-hot encode categorical variables
encoder = OneHotEncoder(drop='first', sparse_output=False, handle_unknown='ignore')

numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

    test_df[col] = test_df[col].fillna(test_df[col].mode()[0] if not test_df[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import xgboost as xgb
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.optim as optim
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader, TensorDataset
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['SalePrice', 'Id'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_val = validation_df.drop(['SalePrice', 'Id'], axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values in numerical columns
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))
X_val[numerical_columns] = X_val[numerical_columns].fillna(X_val[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))
test_df[numerical_columns] = test_df[numerical_columns].fillna(test_df[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))

# Handle missing values in categorical columns

    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode()[0] if not X_train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].fillna(X_val[col].mode()[0] if not X_val[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')
    test_df[col] = test_df[col].fillna(test_df[col].mode()[0] if not test_df[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')

# One-hot encode categorical variables
